intro: Hieracium hirtellum, commonly known as the hairy hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and along stream banks, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are hairy and serrated, while its yellow flowers bloom in late summer. Hieracium hirtellum is often found in disturbed habitats and can spread aggressively through its rhizomes.
